card.name: Abandon Hope
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Abandon Hope, discard X cards.
Look at target opponent's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
card.flavor: As Gerrard's form vanished into the maw of trees, Hanna mouthed a silent plea, mourning a crushed dream.

card.name: Advance Scout
card.ability:
First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Aftershock
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"Every act of destruction has a repercussion."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Altar Of Dementia
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Target player puts a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor:
"It is not that you will go mad. It is that you will beg for madness."
—Volrath

card.name: Aluren
card.ability: Any player may play creature cards with converted mana cost 3 or less without paying their mana cost and as though they had flash.
card.flavor:
Squee bounced up and down. "I sees a horsey, an' a piggy, an' a—"
"If you don't shut up," hissed Mirri, "you'll see a kidney and a spleeny."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The mana cost of the creatures being cast is still the stated cost on the card, even though you did not pay the cost.
10/4/2004 : Aluren checks the actual printed cost on the creature card, and is not affected by things which allow you to cast the spell for less.
10/4/2004 : You can't choose to cast a creature as though it had flash via Aluren and still pay the mana cost. You either cast the creature normally, or via Aluren without paying the mana cost.
10/4/2004 : You can't use Aluren when casting a creature using another alternate means, such as the Morph ability.
8/1/2008 : If creature with X in its cost is cast this way, X can only be 0.

card.name: Ancient Runes
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Ancient Runes deals damage to that player equal to the number of artifacts he or she controls.
card.flavor: Ertai volunteered to open the portal. He figured he owed it one.

card.name: Ancient Tomb
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Ancient Tomb deals 2 damage to you.
card.flavor:
There is no glory to be gained in the kingdom of the dead.
—Vec tomb inscription

card.name: Angelic Protector
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"My family sheltered in her light, the dark was content to wait."
—Crovax
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The ability triggers when Angelic Protector is chosen as a target for a spell or ability. The Protectors ability will be put on the stack above that spell or ability, and so resolve first.

card.name: Anoint
card.ability:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

card.name: Apes of Rath
card.ability: Whenever Apes of Rath attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: Monkeys three, monkeys through.

card.name: Apocalypse
card.ability: Exile all permanents. You discard your hand.
card.flavor:
"There is a future in which I can see only mist and a single shadow."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Armor Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."
card.flavor:
Hanna: "We must learn how they protect each other."
Mirri: "After they've done trying to kill us, all right?"

card.name: Armored Pegasus
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahli en-Dal, bounty hunter

card.name: Auratog
card.ability: Sacrifice an enchantment: Auratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The auratog enjoys eating its wards.

card.name: Avenging Angel
card.ability:
Flying
When Avenging Angel dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This has been restored as a triggered ability that triggers when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, rather than a replacement effect. The Angel does go to the graveyard, and will trigger any other abilities that look for this event.

card.name: Barbed Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
card.flavor: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the Weatherlight.

card.name: Bayou Dragonfly
card.ability: Flying, swampwalk
card.flavor:
"Like a sugar stick with wings"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

card.name: Bellowing Fiend
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

card.name: Benthic Behemoth
card.ability: Islandwalk
card.flavor:
"Deep devourer concealed in darkhome
Shrouded it seeks all becomes fodder
Once we swam alone and asea
But no more."
—Rootwater Saga

card.name: Blood Frenzy
card.ability:
Cast Blood Frenzy only before the combat damage step.
Target attacking or blocking creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"When Torahn bellows, none survive—not even the warrior whose horns he rides."
—Talruum adage

card.name: Blood Pet
card.ability: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

card.name: Boil
card.ability: Destroy all Islands.
card.flavor:
"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Booby Trap
card.ability:
As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, name a card other than a basic land card and choose an opponent.
The chosen player reveals each card he or she draws.
When the chosen player draws the named card, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The "if you do" part is only done if you successfully sacrifice this card. In other words, it has to be on the battlefield when the trigger resolves or it does not deal damage.
8/1/2005 : The choice of which card to name is part of the resolution of the spell or ability which puts Booby Trap onto the battlefield.  It can't be countered.
8/1/2005 : If an effect causes the player to draw multiple cards, each card is revealed as it's drawn. If Booby Trap's ability triggers, it will go on the stack once the card-drawing effect has concluded.
8/1/2005 : If a single Booby Trap's ability triggers multiple times, then only the first ability to resolve causes Booby Trap to be sacrificed and damage to be dealt.
8/1/2005 : If Booby Trap's last ability is countered, Booby Trap remains on the battlefield (and no damage is dealt).

card.name: Bottle Gnomes
card.ability: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
card.flavor:
"I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Bounty Hunter
card.ability:
{T}: Put a bounty counter on target nonblack creature.
{T}: Destroy target creature with a bounty counter on it.
card.flavor: "Once they've marked you," Starke said, "the world is made of glass."

card.name: Broken Fall
card.ability: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
card.flavor:
"I think I used up all my good luck and all my bad luck in the same fall."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Caldera Lake
card.ability:
Caldera Lake enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool. Caldera Lake deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Canopy Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
"We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Canyon Drake
card.ability:
Flying
{1}, Discard a card at random: Canyon Drake gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "These runes are tough enough without the distraction," Ertai muttered, one eye on the drake.

card.name: Canyon Wildcat
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: "Relative of yours?" Ertai teased. Mirri simply sneered.

card.name: Capsize
card.ability:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

card.name: Carrionette
card.ability: {2}{B}{B}: Exile Carrionette and target creature unless that creature's controller pays {2}. Activate this ability only if Carrionette is in your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since it is exiled as part of the effect and not part of the cost, you can activate its ability more than once.
10/4/2004 : A creature with Protection from Creatures can't be targeted by this card's ability.

card.name: Chaotic Goo
card.ability:
Chaotic Goo enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a +1/+1 counter on Chaotic Goo. If you lose the flip, remove a +1/+1 counter from Chaotic Goo.

card.name: Charging Rhino
card.ability: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor:
"Is it wrong to go straight for what you want? Sneaking is for cats and goblins."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Chill
card.ability: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"Temper, temper."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Choke
card.ability: Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor:
"One day we shall walk where once was water."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Cinder Marsh
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Cinder Marsh doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Black
card.ability: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
card.ability: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Green
card.ability: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Red
card.ability: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Shadow
card.ability: {1}: The next time a creature of your choice with shadow would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can be used on non-combat damage which happens to come from creatures with the Shadow ability.

card.name: Circle of Protection: White
card.ability: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Clergy en-Vec
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor:
"Faith's shield is hammered out by the blows of unbelievers."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Clot Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."
card.flavor:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Cloudchaser Eagle
card.ability:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor:
When the eagle catches a cloud, it tears it into strips that fall to earth.
—Vec myth of the rains
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It destroys one of your enchantments if you are the only player with any enchantments.
10/4/2004 : Nothing happens if there are no legal enchantments to target when it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Coercion
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath

card.name: Coffin Queen
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield, the tracking effect ends and the creature will no longer be exiled if something happens to the Coffin Queen.
10/4/2004 : If the creature put onto the battlefield phases out, the tracking effect continues when it phases back in if the Coffin Queen is still on the battlefield. If the Queen left the battlefield while the creature was phased out, the creature phases in as normal.
10/4/2004 : If the Coffin Queen leaves the battlefield or you lose control of it or it becomes untapped, and the triggered ability resolves before the creature enters the battlefield, then the creature will not be exiled this way.

card.name: Coiled Tinviper
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.

card.name: Cold Storage
card.ability:
{3}: Exile target creature you control.
Sacrifice Cold Storage: Return each creature card exiled with Cold Storage to the battlefield under your control.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card leaves the battlefield, the cards it exiled remain exiled.
10/4/2004 : If it exiles a token creature, the token ceases to exist and will not return.
4/1/2008 : For a time, the second ability returned all cards exiled by it to the battlefield, regardless of what types they had while exiled. It has been restored to its original functionality, so only cards that actually have the type Creature will get returned.

card.name: Commander Greven il-Vec
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
card.flavor:
"Rage is the only freedom left me."
—Greven il-Vec

card.name: Corpse Dance
card.ability:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Corpse Dance only exiles the card if the card is still on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step.
4/1/2008 : The effect only grants Haste until the end of the current turn. If the creature somehow manages to stick around until a later turn, it will no longer have Haste.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.
card.flavor:
"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Crazed Armodon
card.ability: {G}: Crazed Armodon gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. Destroy Crazed Armodon at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: These are its last days. Mourning is over. Rage remains.

card.name: Crown of Flames
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Return Crown of Flames to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It is the forge of kings.

card.name: Cursed Scroll
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : If you have no cards in hand, you still have to name a card. Then you fail to reveal one (since there aren't any). Since the named card wasn't revealed, no damage is dealt.

card.name: Dark Banishing
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"It is the way of most wizards to begin by exiling themselves and to end by exiling everyone else."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Dark Ritual
card.ability: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"If there is such a thing as too much power, I have not discovered it."
—Volrath

card.name: Darkling Stalker
card.ability:
{B}: Regenerate Darkling Stalker.
{B}: Darkling Stalker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"In this dark place, yes, I am afraid of my own shadow."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Dauthi Embrace
card.ability: {B}{B}: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor:
"The Dauthi army grows by screams and bounds."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

card.name: Dauthi Ghoul
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever a creature with shadow dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Dauthi Ghoul.

card.name: Dauthi Horror
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Horror can't be blocked by white creatures.

card.name: Dauthi Marauder
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor:
"The Dauthi came from beneath the Ruins one night, and the darkness cast them in the best possible light."
—Soltari Tales of Life

card.name: Dauthi Mercenary
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}: Dauthi Mercenary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The Dauthi believe they dignify murder by paying for it."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

card.name: Dauthi Mindripper
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Dauthi Mindripper attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Dauthi Slayer
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Slayer attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor:
"They have knives for every soul."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

card.name: Deadshot
card.ability: Tap target creature. It deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.
card.flavor:
"Carrion Keep your distance. My blade will come to you"
—Crovax
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Deadshot can target a creature which is already tapped as its first target, and it will still damage the second target. This is because it taps that creature as an effect, not as a cost.

card.name: Death Pits of Rath
card.ability: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: As the sludge below began to shift and take shapes, Gerrard turned from the railing to Orim. "I suppose," he said, "it's a little too late for prayer, isn't it?"

card.name: Diabolic Edict
card.ability: Target player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

card.name: Dirtcowl Wurm
card.ability: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.
card.flavor: Few of Rath's rivers follow a steady course, so many new channels are carved for them.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : A spell or ability that tells a player to "put a land onto the battlefield" does not count as playing a land.

card.name: Disenchant
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Dismiss
card.ability:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Disturbed Burial
card.ability:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Dracoplasm
card.ability:
Flying
As Dracoplasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of creatures. Dracoplasm's power becomes the total power of those creatures and its toughness becomes their total toughness.
{R}: Dracoplasm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Dread of Night
card.ability: White creatures get -1/-1.
card.flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Dream Cache
card.ability: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.
card.flavor:
"The sanctity of poverty is an invention of the rich."
—Starke

card.name: Dregs of Sorrow
card.ability: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
card.flavor: Crovax gazed on the dead, and for one dark moment he saw a banquet.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : X can be zero.

card.name: Duplicity
card.ability:
When Duplicity enters the battlefield, exile the top five cards of your library face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile all cards from your hand face down. If you do, put all other cards you own exiled with Duplicity into your hand.
At the beginning of your end step, discard a card.
When you lose control of Duplicity, put all cards exiled with Duplicity into their owner's graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The cards are face down all the time. You can't look at them. This applies even to cards from your hand that got swapped out. You have to remember what they were if you care.
4/1/2008 : For a time the last ability triggered when Duplicity left the battlefield. It has been restored to triggering when you lose control of Duplicity.
4/1/2008 : Taking control of another player's Duplicity will trigger the ability that causes the cards they exiled to be put into their owner's graveyard.

card.name: Earthcraft
card.ability: Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap target basic land.
card.flavor:
"The land gives up little, but we are masters of persuasion."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Echo Chamber
card.ability: {4}, {T}: An opponent chooses target creature he or she controls. Put a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield. That token gains haste until end of turn. Exile the token at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The token enters the battlefield as the creature it is copying. This triggers its own and any other appropriate enters the battlefield abilities.
4/1/2008 : The effect only grants Haste until the end of the current turn. If the creature somehow manages to stick around until a later turn, it will no longer have Haste.

card.name: Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
card.ability:
Other Elf creatures have forestwalk.
Other Elves have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"We have been patient. We have planned our attack. We are ready . . . now."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card only gives forestwalk to other Elf creatures. It gives shroud to all other Elf permanents, including non-creatures like Prowess of the Fair.

card.name: Eladamri's Vineyard
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, add {G}{G} to that player's mana pool.
card.flavor: The mushroom wine made Gerrard's head spin, and his stomach soon followed suit.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It will not trigger a second time in a turn, even if you cast a spell that gives you a third main phase.
10/4/2004 : Only the first main phase each turn is considered a precombat main phase, even if other combat phases are created (with Relentless Assault, for example).

card.name: Elite Javelineer
card.ability: Whenever Elite Javelineer blocks, it deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.
card.flavor:
"Precision is frequently more valuable than force."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Elven Warhounds
card.ability: Whenever Elven Warhounds becomes blocked by a creature, put that creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"If a creature is dumb enough to love you for leashing it, why would you want to follow its lead?"
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Elvish Fury
card.ability:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Emerald Medallion
card.ability: Green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
10/4/2004 : This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
10/4/2004 : The effect is cumulative.
10/4/2004 : The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
10/4/2004 : Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
10/4/2004 : If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

card.name: Emmessi Tome
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
card.flavor: It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale.

card.name: Endless Scream
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Endless Scream enters the battlefield with X scream counters on it.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each scream counter on Endless Scream.
card.flavor:
"I have made Crovax weep; now I will make him scream. The pain will not end, but will bind him to me."
—Volrath

card.name: Energizer
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Energizer.
card.flavor: Like a kettle set to boil, it must eventually go off—on someone.

card.name: Enfeeblement
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
card.flavor: Crovax had witnessed Selenia lead the Predator to the Weatherlight. As the battle raged on deck, he felt his strength melt in the heat of her betrayal.

card.name: Enraging Licid
card.ability:
{R}, {T}: Enraging Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has haste.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.
4/15/2013 : If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

card.name: Ertai's Meddling
card.ability:
X can't be 0.
Target spell's controller exiles it with X delay counters on it.
At the beginning of each of that player's upkeeps, if that card is exiled, remove a delay counter from it. If the card has no delay counters on it, he or she puts it onto the stack as a copy of the original spell.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Note that a delayed spell that targets another spell will be countered when it resolves since it will find that its target is no longer on the stack.
10/4/2004 : A targeted spell which is delayed will still succeed even if its target has phased out and back in again.
10/4/2004 : Ertai's Meddling can't be cast through any way that doesn't pay its mana cost. This is because the X in the Meddling's mana cost can't be 0, but effects that allow spells to be cast without paying their mana costs set X to 0.
10/4/2004 : If a copy of a spell (one that has no card representing it) is affected by Ertai's Meddling, the spell ceases to exist when exiled. It will not gain counters and will not be put back on the stack.
10/4/2004 : Once it is put back on the stack, it is a "new" spell again and can be countered or even targeted by another Ertai's Meddling.
10/4/2004 : If Ertai's Meddling is used to copy a spell being cast face down due to Morph ability, the spell will create a face up, 2/2, colorless, nameless creature with no text. This may be a little counter-intuitive, because you might expect the card to enter the battlefield face down like it would have when originally cast, but Ertai's Meddling copies only the original spell and not the entire card the spell represented.
4/1/2008 : This now exiles the spell as part of Ertai's Meddling's resolution, instead of waiting for the targeted spell to start resolving.
1/22/2011 : If the spell was cast using flashback, Ertai's Meddling will still exile it with delay counters on it. When the card is returned to the stack, it still "remembers" the flashback cost was originally paid. It'll be exiled when it resolves or otherwise leaves the stack.
4/15/2013 : If Ertai's Meddling is used to copy an arcane spell that had effects spliced onto it, it will create a spell with all of those effects. That spell's controller will not be able to splice additional effects onto the spell, since they did not re-cast the spell and instead simply put it back onto the stack.
4/15/2013 : Ertai's Meddling has the spell's controller put the spell back onto the stack; it does not have its controller cast the spell again. Anything that triggers off of casting spells, such as Contemplation , won't trigger. Simillarly, effects that count spells that are cast (like Rule of Law) or prevent spells from being cast (like Iona, Shield of Emeria) won't count or affect the copy that is put onto the stack since the copy wasn't cast.

card.name: Escaped Shapeshifter
card.ability: As long as an opponent controls a creature with flying not named Escaped Shapeshifter, Escaped Shapeshifter has flying. The same is true for first strike, trample, and protection from any color.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : In a multiplayer game, it works if any opponent controls creatures with the appropriate abilities.

card.name: Essence Bottle
card.ability:
{3}, {T}: Put an elixir counter on Essence Bottle.
{T}, Remove all elixir counters from Essence Bottle: You gain 2 life for each elixir counter removed this way.

card.name: Evincar's Justice
card.ability:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Evincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

card.name: Excavator
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a basic land: Target creature gains landwalk of each of the land types of the sacrificed land until end of turn.
card.ruling: 11/1/2005 : If a land with the supertype "basic" somehow has multiple subtypes, then the creature will gain landwalk of all those types.

card.name: Extinction
card.ability: Destroy all creatures of the creature type of your choice.
card.flavor:
"I once had an entire race killed just to listen to the rattling of their dried bones as I waded through them."
—Volrath

card.name: Fevered Convulsions
card.ability: {2}{B}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor:
"Tell me again why you failed to capture Gerrard, you worthless pile of spine."
—Volrath, to Greven

card.name: Field of Souls
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have two of these on the battlefield, both will trigger when a non-token creature goes to the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : This only triggers on creatures going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

card.name: Fighting Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Two things are needed to survive the harsh skies of Rath: a thick hide and a thicker skull.

card.name: Firefly
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Firefly gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"If they don't pinch, they burn. Can't ya eat any of da bugs here?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

card.name: Fireslinger
card.ability: {T}: Fireslinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"Remember the moral of the fireslinger fable: with power comes isolation."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Flailing Drake
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Flailing Drake blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Too many choices will always distract a greedy beast.

card.name: Flickering Ward
card.ability:
Enchant creature
As Flickering Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Flickering Ward.
{W}: Return Flickering Ward to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If you choose White, the enchanted creature will have Protection from White. This will cause any other white Auras attached to that creature to be put into their owner's graveyard, but Flickering Ward will remain on the battlefield.

card.name: Flowstone Giant
card.ability: {R}: Flowstone Giant gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
When the first of these giants woke from the bedrock, he was still sleepy. He yawned and stretched until his legs grew so thin that they snapped like icicles in the sun.
—Vec lore

card.name: Flowstone Salamander
card.ability: {R}: Flowstone Salamander deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.
card.flavor: The Furnace of Rath is periodically illuminated by their sparkling yawns.

card.name: Flowstone Sculpture
card.ability: {2}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Flowstone Sculpture or Flowstone Sculpture gains flying, first strike, or trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: The sculptor, weary of his work, created art that would finish itself.

card.name: Flowstone Wyvern
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Flowstone Wyvern gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Fool's Tome
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor:
Squee: "What's that?"
Ertai: "It's a magical book."
Squee: "Am I smart enough ta use it?"
Ertai: "You could say that."

card.name: Frog Tongue
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Frog Tongue enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: "But why can't I get one?" sniveled Squee. "All da bugs here got wings."
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Fugitive Druid
card.ability: Whenever Fugitive Druid becomes the target of an Aura spell, you draw a card.
card.flavor:
"If the druids are so devoted to their trees, I will carve them coffins from their precious heartwood."
—Volrath

card.name: Furnace of Rath
card.ability: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
10/4/2004 : The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
10/4/2004 : If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
10/4/2004 : The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.
8/1/2005 : If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting himself or herself. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

card.name: Fylamarid
card.ability:
Flying
Fylamarid can't be blocked by blue creatures.
{U}: Target creature becomes blue until end of turn.

card.name: Gallantry
card.ability:
Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "Forgive me," Mirri whispered. "I thought you a burden, and you saved my life." Hanna quietly accepted the apology.

card.name: Gaseous Form
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Gerrard's Battle Cry
card.ability: {2}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Gerrard grinned and drew his sword. "This won't be a fair fight," he called to his crew. "They should have brought a second ship"

card.name: Ghost Town
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{0}: Return Ghost Town to its owner's hand. Activate this ability only if it's not your turn.
card.flavor:
"The air here smells like a grave."
—Crovax

card.name: Giant Crab
card.ability: {U}: Giant Crab gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: During the giant crabs' mating season, Skyshroud nights are filled with the clatter of their skirmishes.

card.name: Giant Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
card.flavor: "Crovax seems filled only with shadows," thought Orim. "Where does his strength come from?"

card.name: Goblin Bombardment
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Grindstone
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.
card.flavor:
"Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone."
—Crovax
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the two cards are both colorless, then the effect does not repeat. It only repeats if both cards have at least one color and at least one color is shared between them.
10/4/2004 : The effect repeats as many times as it takes to meet the end condition.

card.name: Hand to Hand
card.ability: During combat, players can't cast instant spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
card.flavor: The match between Tahngarth and Greven was close only in the mind of the minotaur.

card.name: Hanna's Custody
card.ability: All artifacts have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"I protect the Legacy with my life if necessary, for its purpose is far more important than my own."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Harrow
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Changing Rath's landscape is like tearing the scab from a wound.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
10/4/2004 : The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Havoc
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, he or she loses 2 life.
card.flavor: As Orim put the lightning rod into place on the bow, she cast a spell of protection to shield herself from the heat. That's when the Furnace got personal.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : In a multiplayer game, it affects all opponents.

card.name: Heart Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have haste.
card.flavor: Gerrard looked all around for the source of the mysterious pulse, and at that moment the slivers boiled forth from the crevasses.

card.name: Heartwood Dryad
card.ability: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow as though Heartwood Dryad had shadow.
card.flavor: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.

card.name: Heartwood Giant
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.

card.name: Heartwood Treefolk
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor:
"In all my years in Llanowar I never understood where trees fit in. They are revered by elves and watered on by dogs."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Helm of Possession
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Helm of Possession during your untap step.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Helm of Possession and Helm of Possession remains tapped.

card.name: Hero's Resolve
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.
card.flavor:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Horned Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have trample.
card.flavor: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the Weatherlight's timbers.

card.name: Horned Turtle
card.flavor:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Humility
card.ability: All creatures lose all abilities and are 1/1.
card.flavor:
"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem
card.ruling:
2/1/2006 : With a Humility and two Opalescences on the battlefield, if Humility has the latest timestamp, then all creatures are 1/1 with no abilities. If the timestamp order is Opalescence, Humility, Opalescence, the second Opalescence is 1/1, and the Humility and first Opalescence are 4/4.  If Humility has the earliest timestamp, then everything is 4/4.
2/1/2007 : Removes all creature abilities. This includes mana abilities. Animated lands will also lose the ability to tap for mana.
10/1/2009 : This is the current interaction between Humility and Opalescence: The type-changing effect applies at layer 4, but the rest happens in the applicable layers.  The rest of it will apply even if the permanent loses its ability before it's finished applying. So if Opalescence, Humility, and Worship are on the battlefield and Opalescence entered the battlefield before Humility, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments. (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities. (Humility) Layer 7b: Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4. (Opalescence).  Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). But if Humility entered the battlefield before Opalescence, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments (Opalescence). Layer 6:  Humility and Worship each lose their abilities (Humility). Layer 7b: Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility).  Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4 (Opalescence).
10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Imps' Taunt
card.ability:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature attacks this turn if able.

card.name: Insight
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.
card.flavor:
"We can fight with you or against you. After my day, I'd prefer the former."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Interdict
card.ability:
Counter target activated ability from an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land. That permanent's activated abilities can't be activated this turn. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card targets the ability, and not the permanent itself.

card.name: Intuition
card.ability: Search your library for three cards and reveal them. Target opponent chooses one. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 7/15/2006 : Targets an opponent. You choose an opponent during announcement. If you can't target an opponent, you can't cast this card.

card.name: Invulnerability
card.ability:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

card.name: Jackal Pup
card.ability: Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
card.flavor: The first morning after acquiring her familiar, the wizard awoke with fleabites and mange.

card.name: Jet Medallion
card.ability: Black spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
10/4/2004 : This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
10/4/2004 : The effect is cumulative.
10/4/2004 : The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
10/4/2004 : Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
10/4/2004 : If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

card.name: Jinxed Idol
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol.
card.flavor: "Here."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Your opponent can use the ability to give this card back to you.
8/15/2010 : The control-change effect has no duration. The targeted player retains control of Jinxed Idol until the game ends, Jinxed Idol leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of it (perhaps because Jinxed Idol's ability is activated again).
8/15/2010 : If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

card.name: Kezzerdrix
card.ability:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if your opponents control no creatures, Kezzerdrix deals 4 damage to you.

card.name: Kindle
card.ability: Kindle deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.
card.flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Counts the Kindles in graveyard on resolution.

card.name: Knight Of Dawn
card.ability:
First strike
{W}{W}: Knight of Dawn gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor:
Flash like daybreak to the fray.
—Motto of the Knights of Dawn

card.name: Knight of Dusk
card.ability: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.
card.flavor:
Fall like night upon the foe.
—Motto of the Knights of Dusk

card.name: Krakilin
card.ability:
Krakilin enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Krakilin.
card.flavor:
"A perfect reflection of its world: brutal, fetal, and lacking truth."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Leeching Licid
card.ability:
{B}, {T}: Leeching Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Leeching Licid deals 1 damage to that player.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.
4/15/2013 : If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

card.name: Legacy's Allure
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The "power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on this card" restriction is a targeting restriction and will be checked on resolution in addition to on announcement. If the creature's power changes to be greater than this before the effect resolves, then the Legacy's Allure triggered ability is countered, but the card stays in the graveyard.

card.name: Legerdemain
card.ability: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. ‘Glok,' he mumbled, and hid.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : You can't cast Legerdemain unless both targets share a type at that time. It will also check to make sure they share a type as it resolves. If they no longer do so, the exchange will not occur.

card.name: Light of Day
card.ability: Black creatures can't attack or block.
card.flavor:
"I do not miss sunlight. The very memory of it burns my eyes."
—Volrath

card.name: Lightning Blast
card.ability: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Lightning Elemental
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: A lightning elemental once killed an entire tribe of merfolk—simply by going for a swim.

card.name: Living Death
card.ability: Each player exiles all creature cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creatures which are sacrificed can't be regenerated.
10/4/2004 : If two of the same Legendary permanent enter the battlefield, both will be put into the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : Both players exile their creature cards at once. Then both players sacrifice all creatures they control at once. Then both players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield. If there are any choices involved for a given step, the current player makes their choices first, then the other player, and finally you do the action all at once.

card.name: Lobotomy
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You only get to pick one card from the player's hand.
10/4/2004 : If the player has no cards in their hand, you still get to look through their deck, but you do not get to exile any cards.
10/4/2004 : It exiles the chosen card plus all others in the hand, library, and graveyard. Some people thought the chosen card was not exiled due to some vague wording.
10/4/2004 : Does not affect cards on the battlefield.
2/1/2005 : The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

card.name: Lotus Petal
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."

card.name: Lowland Giant
card.flavor: "Faugh" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

card.name: Maddening Imp
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Non-Wall creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy each of those creatures that didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn and only before combat.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If a creature can't attack because of some restriction, or because it is tapped, it is destroyed at the end of the turn.

card.name: Magmasaur
card.ability:
Magmasaur enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a +1/+1 counter from Magmasaur. If you don't, sacrifice Magmasaur and it deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to each creature without flying and each player.

card.name: Magnetic Web
card.ability:
If a creature with a magnet counter on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them attack if able.
Whenever a creature with a magnet counter on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them block that creature this turn if able.
{1}, {T}: Put a magnet counter on target creature.

card.name: Mana Severance
card.ability: Search your library for any number of land cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"And when this land is wasted, where will we go?"
—Thalakos lament

card.name: Manakin
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Hanna regarded Squee sternly. "Because it's not a toy, no matter how much it may look like one," she said, taking the manakin from him.

card.name: Manta Riders
card.ability: {U}: Manta Riders gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Water is firmament to the finned."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Marble Titan
card.ability: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor:
"Strapping on nine hundred pounds of armor every morning would make any warrior cross."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Marsh Lurker
card.ability: Sacrifice a Swamp: Marsh Lurker gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: From the mists it rises, into the mists it retreats; through the mists it walks, fearless and unseen.

card.name: Master Decoy
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor:
"A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Mawcor
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.

card.name: Maze of Shadows
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Untap target attacking creature with shadow. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

card.name: Meditate
card.ability: Draw four cards. You skip your next turn.
card.flavor:
"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You skip one turn as part of the effect.

card.name: Metallic Sliver
card.flavor: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

card.name: Mindwhip Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Target player discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery."
card.flavor:
"They share more than their thoughts. We must shatter their link quickly"
—Hanna, to Orim
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.
4/15/2013 : If you cast a Sliver as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

card.name: Minion of the Wastes
card.ability:
Trample
As Minion of the Wastes enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life.
Minion of the Wastes's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.
card.ruling: 1/25/2011 : The life is paid as Minion of the Wastes enters the battlefield. If Minion of the Wastes is countered, you don't get the opportunity to pay any life.

card.name: Mirri's Guile
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor: Hanna was astounded. Mirri read every leaf and wisp of breeze like a book of ancient lore.

card.name: Mnemonic Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."
card.flavor:
"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Mogg Cannon
card.ability: {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: Moggs never volunteer for anything twice.

card.name: Mogg Conscripts
card.ability: Mogg Conscripts can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
card.flavor:
"Torahn's horns They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself"
—Tahngarth, aboard the Predator
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Mogg Fanatic
card.ability: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "I got it I got it I—"

card.name: Mogg Hollows
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Mogg Hollows doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Mogg Raider
card.ability: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.

card.name: Mogg Squad
card.ability: Mogg Squad gets -1/-1 for each other creature on the battlefield.
card.flavor: As they crept into the Weatherlight's hold, the squad leader held up his hand and whispered, "Stop, goblins—what's that sound?"

card.name: Mongrel Pack
card.ability: When Mongrel Pack dies during combat, put four 1/1 green Hound creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The Hound tokens are put onto the battlefield if it dies during the combat phase, even if it was not an attacker or blocker.

card.name: Mounted Archers
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{W}: Mounted Archers can block an additional creature this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can use the ability multiple times so it can block more than two creatures.
4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Muscle Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
card.flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Yes, it does give the +1/+1 bonus to itself.

card.name: Natural Spring
card.ability: Target player gains 8 life.
card.flavor: Mirri listened intently, even as Hanna held the healing water to her lips. Would the sound of the spring drown out the elves' approach?

card.name: Nature's Revolt
card.ability: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
card.flavor:
"One day the land will don the semblance of flesh and challenge even the plowshare's blade."
—Oracle en-Vec
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Needle Storm
card.ability: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor: The rain is driven like nails.

card.name: No Quarter
card.ability:
Whenever a creature becomes blocked by a creature with lesser power, destroy the blocking creature.
Whenever a creature blocks a creature with lesser power, destroy the attacking creature.
card.flavor: As Gerrard and Greven neared each other, the moggs caught between them realized they should flee.

card.name: Nurturing Licid
card.ability:
{G}, {T}: Nurturing Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.
4/15/2013 : If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

card.name: Opportunist
card.ability: {T}: Opportunist deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
card.flavor: The third time the Oracle glanced suspiciously at him, Starke decided she had glanced twice too often.

card.name: Oracle en-Vec
card.ability: {T}: Target opponent chooses any number of creatures he or she controls. During that player's next turn, the chosen creatures attack if able, and other creatures can't attack. At the beginning of that turn's end step, destroy each of the chosen creatures that didn't attack. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The way the card works is that the target player chooses which creatures will attack on their next turn. Creatures which are chosen to attack, but do not attack, are destroyed at the end of that turn. Creatures which are not chosen to be attackers are not affected in any way other than being unable to attack.

card.name: Orim, Samite Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor:
"The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."
—Orim, Samite healer

card.name: Orim's Prayer
card.ability: Whenever one or more creatures attack you, you gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
card.flavor:
"As usual, there will be time for prayer only after the worst happens."
—Orim, Samite healer
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The ability only triggers when one or more creatures attack you. It will not trigger on creatures attacking a planeswalker you control.

card.name: Overrun
card.ability: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: Frozen by conscience, Karn did not resist as the moggs carried him to the Predator.

card.name: Pallimud
card.ability:
As Pallimud enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Pallimud's power is equal to the number of tapped lands the chosen player controls.
card.flavor: The old Vec tell tales of a beast that fed on scraps but turned its nose up at the lavish banquet they set in its honor.

card.name: Patchwork Gnomes
card.ability: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.
card.flavor:
"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Pearl Medallion
card.ability: White spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
10/4/2004 : This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
10/4/2004 : The effect is cumulative.
10/4/2004 : The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
10/4/2004 : Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
10/4/2004 : If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

card.name: Pegasus Refuge
card.ability: {2}, Discard a card: Put a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
The first Rath-born pegasus was so offended by the sky that it hid its eyes in the earth.
—Vec lore

card.name: Perish
card.ability: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Phyrexian Grimoire
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Target opponent chooses one of the top two cards of your graveyard. Exile that card and put the other one into your hand.
card.flavor: Every page cost a life; every secret cost a thousand more.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If there is only one card in your graveyard, it is exiled by the first part of the effect and you do not get to put any cards into your hand since the second part fails.
10/15/2006 : It does not target the cards, but it targets the opponent. If you can’t target an opponent, you can’t activate this ability.

card.name: Phyrexian Hulk
card.flavor:
"They are convenient in having no souls, but less so in having no spirit."
—Volrath

card.name: Phyrexian Splicer
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Choose one — flying; first strike; shadow; or trample. Target creature with that ability loses it until end of turn and another target creature gains it until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the target which is having the ability removed does not have that ability during the resolution of this effect, then this effect still grants the chosen ability. The reason is that the second target is still legal even if the first one is not.

card.name: Pincher Beetles
card.ability: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"No fair Since when does a bug get ta munch on me?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

card.name: Pine Barrens
card.ability:
Pine Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Pine Barrens deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Pit Imp
card.ability:
Flying
{B}: Pit Imp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
card.flavor: The moans of the Death Pits were underscored by the chattering of imps, for whom the ship was cause for much discussion.

card.name: Power Sink
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.
10/4/2004 : When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.
3/1/2010 : Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

card.name: Precognition
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of target opponent's library. If you do, you may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.
card.flavor: A gleam like struggling sunlight penetrated Selenia's dark thoughts.

card.name: Propaganda
card.ability: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
card.flavor:
"You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more."
—Volrath, to Karn
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The payment is made during the declare attackers step at the same time you are declaring the attacker.
10/4/2004 : If there is more than one Propaganda on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.
10/4/2004 : If there are multiple attacks in a turn, then you have to pay for each attack.
10/4/2004 : Paying this cost is not an Instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.
2/1/2007 : In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

card.name: Puppet Strings
card.ability: {2}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."

card.name: Quickening Licid
card.ability:
{1}{W}, {T}: Quickening Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has first strike.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.
4/15/2013 : If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

card.name: Rain of Tears
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor:
"These rains cannot quench; they carve the land's face like a scalpel on flesh."
—Crovax

card.name: Rampant Growth
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Ranger en-Vec
card.ability:
First strike
{G}: Regenerate Ranger en-Vec.
card.flavor:
"The path of least resistance will seldom lead you beyond your doorstep."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Rathi Dragon
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.
card.flavor:
Wrap the flame as twine
Kingdoms will be thine.

card.name: Rats of Rath
card.ability: {B}: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land you control.
card.flavor:
"These creatures offer new challenges in the scrutiny of entrails."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Reality Anchor
card.ability:
Target creature loses shadow until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"See how you like it."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Reanimate
card.ability: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : You lose life equal to the converted mana cost of the card you're bringing back, so if you Reanimate Volrath's Shapeshifter, you lose three life, regardless of what the next card down is.

card.name: Reap
card.ability: Return up to X target cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of black permanents target opponent controls as you cast Reap.
card.flavor:
"Let Volrath choke on his crop of hatred."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : This card has received errata so that it now targets a specific opponent.
4/1/2008 : The count of the number of black permanents the targeted opponent controls is done during announcement since it only affects target selection. It does not get recounted later.

card.name: Reckless Spite
card.ability: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
card.flavor:
"My plan's elegance leads my enemies to believe it is spite that fuels me."
—Volrath

card.name: Recycle
card.ability:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you play a card, draw a card.
Your maximum hand size is two.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : Your maximum hand size is checked only during the cleanup step of your turn. At any other time, you may have any number of cards in hand.
2/1/2007 : Countering a spell that has been cast will not prevent you from drawing the card.
10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Spellbook (an artifact that says you have no maximum hand size) onto the battlefield and then put Recycle onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size will be two. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, you would have no maximum hand size.

card.name: Reflecting Pool
card.ability: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that a land you control could produce.
card.flavor:
"The reflection of land interests me far more than its reality."
—Volrath
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Any replacement effects are considered by Reflecting Pool when determining the types of mana a land can produce.
10/4/2004 : Any change to a land's type or splicing of text into a land can affect the types of mana a land can produce.
5/1/2008 : The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
5/1/2008 : Reflecting Pool checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands you control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag says "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool." If you control Vivid Crag and Reflecting Pool, you can tap Reflecting Pool for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.
5/1/2008 : Reflecting Pool doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your lands put on the mana they produce, such as Pillar of the Paruns and Hall of the Bandit Lord do. It just cares about types of mana.
5/1/2008 : Multiple Reflecting Pools won't help each other produce mana. If you control a Reflecting Pool, and all other lands you control either lack mana abilities or are other Reflecting Pools, you may still activate Reflecting Pool's ability -- it just won't produce any mana.

card.name: Renegade Warlord
card.ability:
First strike
Whenever Renegade Warlord attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"His tongue must be honey, the way he gathers ants to fight with him."
—Volrath

card.name: Repentance
card.ability: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
card.flavor:
"The cannon wasn't aimed at you" pleaded Vhati.
"I'm not sure which is more pathetic," replied Greven, "your judgment or your aim."

card.name: Respite
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
card.flavor: "If they board us we're finished," warned Orim. Crovax nodded. "And if they don't . . . what then?"

card.name: Rolling Thunder
