card.ability: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : X can be zero.
10/4/2004 : If X is greater than zero, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets. If X is zero, you can't choose any targets.

card.name: Root Maze
card.ability: Artifacts and lands enter the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor:
"We should step up repairs. I think the forest has plans for us."
—Crovax

card.name: Rootbreaker Wurm
card.ability: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
card.flavor: As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.

card.name: Rootwalla
card.ability: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

card.name: Rootwater Depths
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Rootwater Depths doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Rootwater Diver
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Rootwater Diver: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"Drop a dagger into the murky deep and the merfolk will cut your throat with it."
—Skyshroud saying

card.name: Rootwater Hunter
card.ability: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Bitter water vicious wave
Shadow-cold shallows root-made maze
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga

card.name: Rootwater Matriarch
card.ability: {T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as that creature is enchanted.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can target an unenchanted creature but has no effect on that creature.
8/1/2005 : A creature is "enchanted" if it has any Auras attached to it.
7/15/2007 : Unlike many similar creatures, Rootwater Matriarch untaps as normal during your untap step. Whether it's tapped or untapped has no bearing on the control-change effect.
2/1/2009 : The control effect applies so long as at least one Aura is attached to the creature, and will continue to apply even if Rootwater Matriarch has left the battlefield. The effect ends if at any time the creature has no Auras on it.

card.name: Rootwater Shaman
card.ability: You may cast Aura cards with enchant creature as though they had flash.
card.flavor:
"Ugh When did orcs and fish start having kids?"
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Ruby Medallion
card.ability: Red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
10/4/2004 : This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
10/4/2004 : The effect is cumulative.
10/4/2004 : The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
10/4/2004 : Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
10/4/2004 : If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

card.name: Sacred Guide
card.ability: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Sacred Guide: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a white card. Put that card into your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.

card.name: Sadistic Glee
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Safeguard
card.ability: {2}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"I'm amused by wasted effort when it's not my own."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Salt Flats
card.ability:
Salt Flats enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Salt Flats deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Sandstone Warrior
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I used to describe something stable as ‘rock solid.' So much for that expression."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Sapphire Medallion
card.ability: Blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
10/4/2004 : This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
10/4/2004 : The effect is cumulative.
10/4/2004 : The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
10/4/2004 : Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
10/4/2004 : If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

card.name: Sarcomancy
card.ability:
When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Scabland
card.ability:
Scabland enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool. Scabland deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Scalding Tongs
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have three or fewer cards in hand, Scalding Tongs deals 1 damage to target opponent.
card.flavor:
"This has nothing to do with what you know and everything to do with what I wish."
—Volrath
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You target one opposing player each time the ability triggers.
10/4/2004 : It checks the number of cards in your hand at the beginning of upkeep and does not trigger at all if you have more than three. It checks again on resolution and does not deal damage unless you still have 3 or fewer cards.

card.name: Scorched Earth
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Scorched Earth, discard X land cards.
Destroy X target lands.
card.flavor:
"Fire cleanses as well as destroys; that is the nature of change."
—Oracle en-Vec
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : X can be zero to destroy no lands.

card.name: Scragnoth
card.ability:
Scragnoth can't be countered.
Protection from blue
card.flavor: It possesses no intelligence, only counter-intelligence.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Side-effects of spells that would counter this card will still happen, because they happen even if the spell they're trying to counter can't be countered.
10/4/2004 : Spells can target Scragnoth and affect it while it is on the stack. Only effects that counter spells are ignored.
10/4/2004 : Spells with a side effect that only happens if a spell is countered do not have their side effect happen when the countering fails.

card.name: Screeching Harpy
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{B}: Regenerate Screeching Harpy.
card.flavor:
"They are called ‘fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Scroll Rack
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Exile any number of cards from your hand face down. Put that many cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and put them on top of your library in any order.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If there are not enough cards in the library, you do not lose. This is not a draw effect. You just get as many cards as are there, even if there are zero cards in the library.

card.name: Sea Monster
card.ability: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.

card.name: Searing Touch
card.ability:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Searing Touch deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Seeker of Skybreak
card.ability: {T}: Untap target creature.
card.flavor:
"We shun them not for their dream but for their refusal to let such a noble dream die a noble death."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can use its tap ability to untap itself.

card.name: Segmented Wurm
card.ability: Whenever Segmented Wurm becomes the target of a spell or ability, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
card.flavor:
"If only we could so easily leave behind those parts of ourselves that pain us."
—Crovax

card.name: Selenia, Dark Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Pay 2 life: Return Selenia, Dark Angel to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"I am light. I am dark. I must give my life to serve; not even death can release me."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Serene Offering
card.ability: Destroy target enchantment. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"A sacrifice made in peace is worth a dozen made in panic."
—Orim, Samite healer

card.name: Servant of Volrath
card.ability: When Servant of Volrath leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
card.flavor:
"Volrath is a harsh master. My reflection is a constant reminder of that."
—Greven il-Vec

card.name: Shadow Rift
card.ability:
Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Draw a card.

card.name: Shadowstorm
card.ability: Shadowstorm deals 2 damage to each creature with shadow.
card.flavor:
"You've not seen a storm until you've seen the kind that roars between worlds."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

card.name: Shatter
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Such fuss over machines, Gerrard. Remember that you are the prize of the Legacy. Throw away your toys"
—Orim, Samite healer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

card.name: Shimmering Wings
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The brighter the wings, the deeper the impact crater.

card.name: Shocker
card.ability: Whenever Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

card.name: Sky Spirit
card.ability: Flying, first strike
card.flavor:
"Like a strain of music: easy to remember but impossible to catch."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Skyshroud Condor
card.ability:
Flying
Cast Skyshroud Condor only if you've cast another spell this turn.
card.flavor:
Condor's flight augurs sleepless night.
—Skyshroud proverb

card.name: Skyshroud Elf
card.ability:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"It is our duty to endure."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Skyshroud Forest
card.ability:
Skyshroud Forest enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. Skyshroud Forest deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Skyshroud Ranger
card.ability: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor:
"Just as you see the grave and remember the friend, I see this forest and remember Llanowar."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Skyshroud Troll
card.ability: {1}{G}: Regenerate Skyshroud Troll.
card.flavor: The elves and merfolk have nothing but bitterness for each other. The trolls, however, find them both rather tasty.

card.name: Skyshroud Vampire
card.ability:
Flying
Discard a creature card: Skyshroud Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"If it tastes one drop of elvish blood I will cast it from the shroud to see it burn."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Soltari Crusader
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{W}: Soltari Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Carry war to the Dauthi, no matter the way, no matter the world."
—Soltari battle chant

card.name: Soltari Emissary
card.ability: {W}: Soltari Emissary gains shadow until end of turn. (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor: Alone at the portal, Ertai began his meditation. He realized immediately that he was not alone.

card.name: Soltari Foot Soldier
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor:
"Children of the Ruins, raised to be warriors, know that life begins when another speaks their names."
—Soltari Tales of Life

card.name: Soltari Guerrillas
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{0}: The next time Soltari Guerrillas would deal combat damage to an opponent this turn, it deals that damage to target creature instead.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : Regardless of when the ability is activated, it will apply to the defending player at the time Soltari Guerrillas tries to deal combat damage to him or her.

card.name: Soltari Lancer
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Soltari Lancer has first strike as long as it's attacking.
card.flavor:
"In times of war the victors rarely save their best for last."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : For a time, the ability that granted it first strike was a triggered ability. It has been restored to a static ability that applies continuously while the Lancer is attacking. There is never a time when the Lancer is attacking but doesn't have first strike.

card.name: Soltari Monk
card.ability:
Protection from black
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor:
"Prayer rarely explains."
—Orim, Samite healer

card.name: Soltari Priest
card.ability:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

card.name: Soltari Trooper
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Trooper attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Dauthi blood is Soltari wine."
—Soltari Tales of Life

card.name: Souldrinker
card.ability: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Souldrinker.
card.flavor: Don't drink and thrive.

card.name: Spell Blast
card.ability: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.
card.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

card.name: Spike Drone
card.ability:
Spike Drone enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Drone: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

card.name: Spinal Graft
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"This one has not screamed enough to show effective implantation. Kill it."
—Volrath

card.name: Spirit Mirror
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Reflection tokens on the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Reflection creature token onto the battlefield.
{0}: Destroy target Reflection.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks if there are any Reflection tokens on the battlefield at the beginning of upkeep, and if there are it will not trigger at all. It will check again on resolution and will do nothing if a Reflection is on the battlefield at that time.

card.name: Spontaneous Combustion
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Spontaneous Combustion, sacrifice a creature.
Spontaneous Combustion deals 3 damage to each creature.
card.flavor: "Heat of battle" is usually a metaphor.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Squee's Toy
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
card.flavor: As the horrors closed in on Gerrard, Squee trembled and clutched his toy for comfort. He didn't know where it came from or why it was so warm, but he was glad he'd kept it near.

card.name: Stalking Stones
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{6}: Stalking Stones becomes a 3/3 Elemental artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Starke of Rath
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target artifact or creature. That permanent's controller gains control of Starke of Rath. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."
—Starke

card.name: Static Orb
card.ability: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
card.flavor:
Time passes, time crawls;
Time doesn't move at all.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If there are two of these on the battlefield, they do not add together. The result is that only two permanents can be untapped.

card.name: Staunch Defenders
card.ability: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"Hold your position Leave doubt for the dying"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Steal Enchantment
card.ability:
Enchant enchantment
You control enchanted enchantment.
card.flavor:
"Why should I flatter another with imitation when I can satisfy myself through possession?"
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : When a player takes control of an enchantment, they do not get to change anything about the enchantment (such as what creature it is on, what choices it has or anything) at that time. They just become its controller.

card.name: Stinging Licid
card.ability:
{1}{U}, {T}: Stinging Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Stinging Licid deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.
4/15/2013 : If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor:
"The land shall beg for drink and curse the rain that follows."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Storm Front
card.ability: {G}{G}: Tap target creature with flying.
card.flavor: The calmest day on Rath would be thought a storm anywhere else.

card.name: Stun
card.ability:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I concede it was a cheap shot, but it was the only one I could afford."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Must be used before blockers are declared in order to affect blocking decisions. You can't wait to see what your opponent declares and then try to stop them.
10/4/2004 : You can use it after combat or even on a creature which can't possibly block this turn because it's that player's turn to attack, but it generally has no effect other than to let you draw a card.

card.name: Sudden Impact
card.ability: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
card.flavor: The Predator roared like an unruly beast, and the Weatherlight suddenly listed. "No" screamed Hanna.

card.name: Tahngarth's Rage
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as it's attacking. Otherwise, it gets -2/-1.
card.flavor:
"Taste my horns"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The effect does not receive a new timestamp when the creature goes from attacking to not attacking or the other way around.

card.name: Talon Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have first strike.
card.flavor: "Keep them at sword's length" Gerrard's order fell flat as each sliver's talon suddenly grew longer. "Hold on—break out the polearms"

card.name: Telethopter
card.ability: Tap an untapped creature you control: Telethopter gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: After losing several of the devices to midair collisions, Greven forbade moggs from operating telethopters.

card.name: Thalakos Dreamsower
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
You may choose not to untap Thalakos Dreamsower during your untap step.
Whenever Thalakos Dreamsower deals damage to an opponent, tap target creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Thalakos Dreamsower remains tapped.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be used on a creature that is already tapped.

card.name: Thalakos Lowlands
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Thalakos Lowlands doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Thalakos Mistfolk
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{U}: Put Thalakos Mistfolk on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"They are ‘between' in every way."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

card.name: Thalakos Seer
card.ability:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
When Thalakos Seer leaves the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"You see our world when you shut your eyes so tightly that tiny shapes float before them."
—Lyna, to Ertai

card.name: Thalakos Sentry
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow)
card.flavor:
"Ill luck and poor geography caught the Thalakos between us and the Dauthi."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

card.name: Thumbscrews
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have five or more cards in hand, Thumbscrews deals 1 damage to target opponent.
card.flavor:
"We will start small, I think."
—Volrath
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks the number of cards in your hand at the beginning of upkeep, and if you have 4 or fewer cards in hand it will not trigger. It checks again when it resolves and will not deal damage unless you still have 5 or more cards in hand.

card.name: Time Ebb
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Time Warp
card.ability: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
card.flavor:
"Let's do it again"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Tooth and Claw
card.ability: Sacrifice two creatures: Put a 3/1 red Beast creature token named Carnivore onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"You deify nature as female—kind and gentle—yet you cringe at what is natural."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Torture Chamber
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a pain counter on Torture Chamber.
At the beginning of your end step, Torture Chamber deals damage to you equal to the number of pain counters on it.
{1}, {T}, Remove all pain counters from Torture Chamber: Torture Chamber deals damage to target creature equal to the number of pain counters removed this way.

card.name: Tradewind Rider
card.ability:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

card.name: Trained Armodon
card.flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

card.name: Tranquility
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments.
card.flavor:
"Peace will come, but whether born of harmony or entropy I cannot say."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Trumpeting Armodon
card.ability: {1}{G}: Target creature blocks Trumpeting Armodon this turn if able.
card.flavor: These are its last days. But it will not go quietly.

card.name: Twitch
card.ability:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Battles are won in nuance.
card.ruling: 3/1/2010 : If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Twitch resolves, the entire spell is countered. You don't draw a card.

card.name: Unstable Shapeshifter
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, Unstable Shapeshifter becomes a copy of that creature and gains this ability.
card.flavor:
"In a world of untruths, the living lie rules."
—Oracle en-Vec
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The copy effect is not targeted.
10/4/2004 : If a creature enters the battlefield that has some characteristic or ability set when it enters the battlefield, the copy does not get to make that choice (because it is not entering the battlefield). All values are zero and all checks for choices consider the choice not to have been made.
10/4/2004 : If the creature has power/toughness that is continuously recalculated, so does this copy of it.
10/4/2004 : When it changes "shape" to a new creature, any "enters the battlefield" abilities of the creature do not trigger.
8/1/2008 : The ability is granted as part of the copy effect, which means it will be removed by any effects that would remove abilities regardless of when the effect was created.
8/1/2008 : If an Unstable Shapeshifter is on the battlefield when another Unstable Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, the first one gets the second one's triggered ability, so will copy the next creature that enters the battlefield twice. It will only do so the next time a creature enters the battlefield, because the second "becomes a copy" effect to resolve will erase the extra triggered ability.

card.name: Vec Townships
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Vec Townships doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Verdant Force
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
Burl, scurf, and bower
Birth fern and flower.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Verdant Force's controller gets the tokens. That is the controller at the beginning of upkeep.
8/1/2005 : Once created, the tokens are independent of Verdant Force.  If Verdant Force changes controllers, the new controller will put tokens onto the battlefield, but existing tokens will stay where they are.
5/1/2006 : In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

card.name: Verdigris
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Vhati il-Dal
card.ability: {T}: Target creature's power or toughness becomes 1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Sir, I just thought . . . ," explained Vhati.
"Don't think," interrupted Greven. "It doesn't suit you."
card.ruling:
9/25/2006 : You don't choose whether to affect the targeted creature's power or its toughness until the ability resolves.
10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Volrath's Curse
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Return Volrath's Curse to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the creature this card is on is sacrificed to this card, this card is put into the graveyard before the ability to unsummon it can be used.

card.name: Wall of Diffusion
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Wall of Diffusion can block creatures with shadow as though Wall of Diffusion had shadow.
card.flavor:
"The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

card.name: Warmth
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a red spell, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor:
"Flame grows gentle with but a little distance."
—Orim, Samite healer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It triggers on all opposing players.

card.name: Wasteland
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.
card.flavor:
"The land promises nothing and keeps its promise."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Watchdog
card.ability:
Watchdog blocks each turn if able.
As long as Watchdog is untapped, all creatures attacking you get -1/-0.
card.flavor: Its growl is a long, rumbling grind of gears and clockwork, its bark a blast of hissing steam.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The second ability is no longer triggered. It continuously checks the tapped/untapped status of the Watchdog, and gives them -1/-0 as appropriate.

card.name: Whim of Volrath
card.ability:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another until end of turn. (For example, you may change "nonred creature" to "nongreen creature" or "plainswalk" to "swampwalk.")
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
10/4/2004 : Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
10/4/2004 : It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
10/4/2004 : It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
10/4/2004 : You choose the words to change on resolution.
10/4/2004 : You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
10/4/2004 : It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

card.name: Whispers of the Muse
card.ability:
Buyback {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I followed her song only to find it was a dirge."
—Crovax

card.name: Wild Wurm
card.ability: When Wild Wurm enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Wild Wurm to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
Wurm heads appear
Wild wurm near
Wurm tails you see
Wild wurm flee

card.name: Wind Dancer
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Flying like a bird does not make you as free as one."
—Volrath

card.name: Wind Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You must do the same."

card.name: Winds of Rath
card.ability: Destroy all creatures that aren't enchanted. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"There shall be a vast shout and then a vaster silence."
—Oracle en-Vec
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : A creature is "enchanted" if it has any Auras attached to it.

card.name: Winged Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have flying.
card.flavor:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Winter's Grasp
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor:
Summer is buried there, centuries deep;
A crypt of years where seasons sleep.

card.name: Wood Sage
card.ability: {T}: Name a creature card. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Worthy Cause
card.ability:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
As an additional cost to cast Worthy Cause, sacrifice a creature.
You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.
